co.cask.cdap.api.procedure
Interface ProcedureResponse.Writer

All Superinterfaces:
Closeable
Enclosing class:
ProcedureResponse
public static interface ProcedureResponse.Writer
extends Closeable

Interface for writing response data.

Method Summary
 ProcedureResponse.Writer write(byte[] bytes)
          Writes the given byte array to the response.
 ProcedureResponse.Writer write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len)
          Writes the given len bytes from bytes to the response, starting with the given offset.
 ProcedureResponse.Writer write(ByteBuffer buffer)
          Writes the content of the given buffer to the response.
 ProcedureResponse.Writer write(String content)
          Writes the given String to the response, using UTF-8 Charset.
 
Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable
close
 

Method Detail

write

ProcedureResponse.Writer write(ByteBuffer buffer)
                               throws IOException
Writes the content of the given buffer to the response.

Parameters:
buffer - ByteBuffer holding the content to be written. After this method returns, the ByteBuffer is drained.
Returns:
The same ProcedureResponse.Writer instance for writing more data.
Throws:
IOException - When there is an error while writing.

write

ProcedureResponse.Writer write(byte[] bytes)
                               throws IOException
Writes the given byte array to the response. Same as calling write(bytes, 0, bytes.length).

Parameters:
bytes - bytes to be written out.
Returns:
The same ProcedureResponse.Writer instance for writing more data.
Throws:
IOException - When there is an error while writing.

write

ProcedureResponse.Writer write(byte[] bytes,
                               int off,
                               int len)
                               throws IOException
Writes the given len bytes from bytes to the response, starting with the given offset.

Parameters:
bytes - bytes to be written out.
Returns:
The same ProcedureResponse.Writer instance for writing more data.
Throws:
IOException - When there is an error while writing.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than bytes.length.

write

ProcedureResponse.Writer write(String content)
                               throws IOException
Writes the given String to the response, using UTF-8 Charset.

Parameters:
content - String content to be written out.
Returns:
The same ProcedureResponse.Writer instance for writing more data.
Throws:
IOException - When there is an error while writing.
